title: Gavin Newsom Signs New Law REQUIRING Gender-Neutral Bathrooms In Schools
description:
The most important thing right now for progressives in California is coming up with new bathroom laws.

All California public schools will be required to provide gender-neutral bathrooms under a law signed by Gov. Gavin Newsom on Saturday.

Public schools teaching first through 12th grade must have at least one gender-neutral bathroom available for students by 2026.

You know, because first graders can choose their gender.

The bill was inspired in regards to an attempt by Chino Valley Unified to restrict students from entering the wrong bathroom or locker rooms.

T

title: Watch: Shirtless Man In Golf Cart Takes His Dog On A Joy Ride, Winds Up Leading Police On A 10-Mile Chase
description:
Some believed he was just a Florida man on vacation. But to the LAPD, he was their worst nightmare.

You typically only hear ‘no shirt, no shoes, no service’ when dining at food establishments. But LAPD officers have now taken that phrase to a whole new level.

In what may have been the slowest police chase in LAPD history, a shirtless man with his dog led police on a low-speed chase for nearly 10 miles in a stolen golf cart.

News helicopter footage showed several squad cars — with lights flashing and sirens blaring — following the cart late Sunday after it was reported stolen from a San Fernando Valley shopping center.

title: Law Capping Magazine Capacity Too Extreme For Even California, Gets Struck Down AGAIN By Federal Judge
description:
As the left continues its war on the second amendment, a federal judge in California on Friday struck down a state law that bans the possession of firearm magazines capable of holding more than 10 rounds, describing the ban as “arbitrary and capricious ... (and) extreme.”

“Based on the text, history, and tradition of the Second Amendment, this law is clearly unconstitutional,” U.S. District Court for the Southern District of California Roger Benitez wrote in a 71-page rulin

title: Pete Buttigieg Dodges Question On If Biden Admin Was 'Caught Off-Guard' On Migrant Surge
description:
Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg has found some spare time from fighting racist bridges to go on “Meet the Press” as he danced around an answer when asked if the Biden administration had been "caught off-guard" over the recent surge in illegals entering the border.

“Let me ask you about what we are seeing at the border. Recently, the administration sent 800 active-duty troops to the Texas border to deal with the surge in migrants, some record numbers this past week. Was the Biden administration caught off guard by this latest surge of migrants?”

title: Watch: AOC Called Out On Her Non-Union Made Tesla While Supporting UAW Strike, Her Excuse Is Derpy
description:
Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez was questioned for her decision to buy a Tesla rather than an EV from a company that employs union workers as labor strikes against automakers continue. And viewers were left even more confused as she spat out her word salad and tried to blame the vaccine.

title: It's official: Ron DeSantis set to debate Gavin Newsom 1-on-1 on Fox News
description:
It's official. Ron DeSantis will be debating Gavin Newsom 1-on-1 on November 30th, live on Hannity. Instead of a stage full of people being asked to raise their hand if they think a man can be a woman, we're going to get two officials who represent polar opposite ideologies fighting it out.

— (@)

Before I go any further, cards on the table:

  1. I, personally, as an individual primary voter, am all-in for DeSantis.
  2. With my caps lock button on, I WILL SUPPORT WHOEVER GETS THE NOMINATION AND IS RUNNING AGAINST BIDEN.

As long as I still have a choice, DeSantis is my dude. Okay? Okay.

title: NBC plans to reboot "The Office," it's the worst idea we've heard since Joe Biden announced reelection
description:
The debate over The Office stems from whether or not you could make it today. It's the new Blazing Saddles as a measuring stick for political correctness. Of course, you COULD make it today. It was the most popular streamed show during the pandemic, regardless of how many humorless, woke, leftist twats whine on X and on their corporate media-owned blogs about how "problematic" the show is. Also, Steve Carell and Mindy Kaling.

title: John Biden Tweets His Support For Concert Ticket Junk Fees, While You Struggle To Afford Gas And Groceries
description:
Since ticket prices are probably the last thing most Americans are concerned about, that is now Joe Biden's top priority as he focuses all his efforts on America's ‘concert fee crisis.’ Because ‘junk fees’ are only allowed when they go to the government.

"Concert tickets are hard enough to get, you shouldn’t have to pay surprise service fees on top of that. My Administration is working to crack down on those junk fees, so you know what you are paying for upfront," Biden wrote on X.

description:

title: Watch: '60 Minutes' exposes what our tax dollars are going to Ukraine for, and it's not just fighting Russians
description:

title: Travis Kelce sells out, not with Taylor Swift, but by cutting this Pfizer ad for Big Pharma
description:
Critics who have hate in their hearts and don't believe in true love have been calling the budding relationship between Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift a publicity stunt. I disagree entirely. These two crazy kids look perfect for each other. And while both Brittany and Jackson Mahomes are upset there is a new Queen of Chiefs Kingdom, the rest of us know romance when we see it.

However, IF I were Travis Kelce, I might be okay with news of my relationship with TayTay taking attention off of me becoming a corporate sell-out to Big Pharma and Pfizer.

title: GOP Debate Preview: DeSantis's Last Stand?
description:
The second GOP primary debate is this Wednesday, September 27th, from the Reagan Library in California. Six out of the seven of the top GOP candidates will be there. Donald Trump, like with the last debate, is showing how brave and strong he is by not showing up and being challenged on his record. (Though he will be leaving the basement to attend a UAW rally in Michigan).

On the debate stage:

  • Ron DeSantis
  • Vivek Ramaswamy
  • Nikki Haley
  • Mike Pence
  • Chris Christie
  • Tim Scott

Setting the Agenda
